string-array.name: advices
string-array.item:
GENERAL 
 Through this application you get to know the Museum of Byzantine Culture of Thessaloniki via a funny treasure hunt. 
 You should visit every room in the museum, answer the questions and gather all your abilities, in order to solve the riddles you come across.
 Complete your museum tour with the greatest score.

 1. Follow the clues on the screen 
 2. Use the QR code scanner to locate the correct exhibit
 3. Fulfill successfully all the questions and the riddles, to increase your score.
 Visit this page: http://83.212.117.226/ and create your own museum.

QUIZ GAME
 One question, four possible answers. 
 The only thing you have to do is to find the right one.
 How good are you in history?

WHERE ARE THE MONUMENTS?
 Can you find the location of the monument on the map, knowing the monument and the location name?
 Choose the location on the map, as close as possible to the right one, to score more points
 The clues you are asking for are hidden on the museum's walls

CATCH ME IF YOU CAN
 The faster your reflexes are the better.
 Hit the moving image in order to complete the bigger picture in the end of the game.
 The more successful hits you manage, the more points you score and you get a cleaner view at on of the museum's masterpieces.

SAVE THE ARCHES
 In fact it is all about the classic hangman game.
 All you have to do is to guess the word before all the arches come down.
 What is the words are kind of unusual and Greek, take a good look at your surroundings and the museum will give you the answer

ALL COINS HAVE TWO FACES
 Can you figure out who they are?
 Match them as soon as possible to score points. The more observant you are, the sooner you will finish.
 Remember nothing is over until you move on to the next room of the museum.
FILL IT UP\n Only if you put everything in place you can see what the picture is hidding.\n It is a classical puzzle game, also known as "Fast and neatly"

FIND THE RIGHT ORDER\n Some of the pottery we admire up to this day, took a lot of time in order to look like this and carry all these details.\n Put in the rigth order the production stages, their names and form, as fast as you can to increase your score

resources.string:
The game "Amusing Museum" is an application for educational purposes. It has been developed in order to help the visitor of the Museum of Byzantine Culture of Thessaloniki, to see the museum via a funny treasure hunt.
 The application was developed during the Summer School of Open Source Projects of University of Macedonia and the department of Applied Informatics.

string-array.name: exhibits_information
string-array.item: Part of a mural mosaic with fountain which until recently was covered by the most recent western wall of the central aisle of the basilica. In detached mosaic, the lower portion luxurious jets is illustrated, shown in blue color, by which overflows water falling on leaf stalks and a bird. The show is developed into a gold background.

Reliquary. Rectangular casket with flat cover, fastened with hooks. Its four sides adorn reliefs with scenes from the Old and New Testaments. On the front side, it represents the Tradition of the Law by Christ to the apostles Peter and Paul. On the reverse side there are depicted the Three Children in the furnace. On narrow sides there are depicted Daniel in the lion\'s den and the delivery of the Ten Commandments to Moses.

Spherical shape amphora with a conical neck ending in poor glass spout. The two arched handles are formed parallel to the shoulders of the amphora. Subtle horizontal grooves mellowed in the wheel run around the body of the amphora at the height of its shoulder.

The obverse shows a bust of Emperor Justinian, with military clothing and crusader bullet in the right hand. All around we read the inscription DN IVSTINIANVS PPAVG (Dominus Noster Iustinianus Perpetuus Augustus, which means, our Lord, Justinian, the eternal emperor).

Vaulted tomb full of paintings organized in panels with scenes from the Old and New Testament. The eastern narrow side of the tomb is decorated with a table surrounded by red and green band and portrays the protoplasts after their disobedience. The show is organized around tree with lush foliage in the trunk of which there is a wrapped snake.

Bracket monopod, of a luxurious table, made from a piece of marble. It consists of a cubic base with four small rectangular legs in its corners- by means of which rests on the ground. The main view of the brace is adorned with sculpted form on the iconographic type of the "Good Shepherd", the young shepherd with a ram on his shoulders.

Pair of gold pods. Each wristband is covered by 20 tiles defined by granular film, which are decorated with fenced technical enamel, cloisonne. The tiles depict alternately a bird pecking a leaf, a palm and a rosette and are rendered in different color variations.

Tetraeuangelo contains readings which are read on Sunday, Saturday and weekdays in the church. It consists of 325 sheets of parchment and is truncated. The text has two columns, with notation, written in an upright, rounded, elaborate minuscule scripture echoing the style of the second half of the 11th and early 12th century.

In one aspect, which is curved, Christ is depicted in the figure of Emmanuel, so he is young. It is flanked by the inscription IC- XC (Jesus Christ) and around the invocation “+ principal assistant “.In the back side, which is hollow, Manuel is illustrated standing wearing an imperial dress, holding banner and crusader orb.

On one side there is depicted the Emperor Heraclius on the left and his son and also emperor Heraclius Constantine on the right, wearing chlamys and crown with a cross. Among their heads there is a cross. All around there is the inscription ddNNhERACLIUS EthERACONSTPPAV (Dominus Noster Heraclius et Heraclius Constantinus Perpetuus Augustus), which means "our Gentlemen Heraclius and Heraclius Constantine the Eternal Emperors".

Filter, or in other words colander or strainer hemispherical. Incised wavy line runs around the rim. The whole body of the vase is pierced. The holes were opened, of course, while the clay was still damp with a sharp tool and with the direction from the interior of the vessel to the outward. The filter has been serving through the centuries the same use which remained in an unchanged shape until today.

The castles were fortified settlements, obtaining the basic functions of a city. They were built in key positions who controlled the passes of roads and offered protection to the inhabitants and residents of the surrounding region in seasons of war. The limited space and the morphology of the terrain determined the urban organization of the castles and the changes in the architecture of the houses.
